intro: Alchornea androgyna, commonly known as the yellow mangrove, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to coastal regions of the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its smooth, waxy leaves and yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in saline and brackish water environments, making it an important component of coastal ecosystems. Alchornea androgyna plays a role in stabilizing shorelines and providing habitat for various marine and terrestrial organisms.
